benchmark_details.name: Compass Direction Reasoning (CDR)
benchmark_details.overview: The Compass Direction Reasoning (CDR) benchmark is designed to evaluate the direction reasoning capabilities of multimodal language models (MLMs). It includes three types of images to test spatial and compass directions, revealing that most MLMs struggle with direction reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the compass and spatial reasoning abilities of multimodal language models.

data.source: Handcrafted image-question pairs specifically designed for this benchmark.
data.annotation: Manually annotated for direction reasoning with specific question types.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the percentage of correct answers provided by the models on the benchmark tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in direction reasoning tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation across multiple popular multimodal language models.
